business_news.markdown:
## ðŸ’¼ Business News - 2025-11-04

### Top Stories

1. ['Make IPOs great again': SEC chair explains new rule for IPOs during shutdown](https://www.foxbusiness.com/media/make-ipos-great-again-sec-chair-explains-new-rule-ipos-during-shutdown)

2. [LARRY KUDLOW: Will economic illiteracy be the big winner tomorrow night?](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/larry-kudlow-economic-illiteracy-big-winner-tomorrow-night)

3. [YouTube gives deadline for users to recover accounts banned for COVID-19, election speech](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/youtube-gives-deadline-users-recover-accounts-banned-political-speech)

4. [National Debt Tracker: American taxpayers (you) are now on the hook for $38,040,093,786,521.02 as of 11/3/25](https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/us-national-debt-tracker)

5. [Fed's Cook breaks silence on Trump firing, vows to continue her duties amid legal fight](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/feds-cook-breaks-silence-trump-firing-vows-continue-her-duties-amid-legal-fight)

6. [Trump admin to partially resume SNAP benefits as shutdown drags on](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/trump-admin-partially-resume-snap-benefits-shutdown-drags)

7. [Musk slams Mamdani as 'charismatic swindler,' warns policies would hurt quality of life in NYC](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/musk-slams-mamdani-charismatic-swindler-warns-policies-would-hurt-quality-life-nyc)

8. [Prepared pasta sold at major grocers tied to 6 deaths, over 2 dozen illnesses](https://www.foxbusiness.com/lifestyle/prepared-pasta-sold-major-grocers-tied-6-deaths-over-two-dozen-illnesses)

9. [Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s open and whatâ€™s closed on Election Day across the country](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/heres-whats-open-and-closed-election-day-2025)

10. [Prediction markets favor Democrats in New York, New Jersey, Virginia Election Day races](https://www.foxbusiness.com/politics/prediction-markets-favor-democrats-new-york-new-jersey-virginia-election-day-races)

### Summary

The SEC chair has announced a new rule aimed at revitalizing IPOs during market shutdowns, indicating a proactive approach to maintaining market momentum. Larry Kudlow raises concerns about economic understanding influencing upcoming events, hinting at the potential consequences of financial illiteracy. YouTube has set a deadline for users to reclaim accounts suspended over COVID-19 or election-related content, reflecting ongoing debates over free speech and platform responsibility. The National Debt Tracker reveals American taxpayers are now responsible for over $38 trillion in debt, highlighting escalating fiscal challenges. Fed's Cook has publicly addressed her continuation in duties despite President Trump's firing, underscoring a commitment to her role amidst legal disputes. These items collectively touch on regulatory adjustments, economic literacy, digital platform governance, fiscal accountability, and the resilience of public servants.

tech_news.markdown:
## ðŸ’» Tech News - 2025-11-04

### Top Stories

1. [Woman Wrongfully Accused by Flock License Plate Cam, Then Exonerated by Car Cam](https://www.cbsnews.com/colorado/news/flock-cameras-lead-colorado-police-wrong-suspect/)

2. [Higher Intelligence Is Correlated with Left-Wing Beliefs and Seems to Be Genetic](https://www.birdsadvice.com/researchers-find-higher-intelligence-is-correlated-with-left-wing-beliefs-and-seems-to-be-genetic/)

3. [Vogue Eats Teen Vogue](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/11/03/style/teen-vogue-website-conde-nast.html)

4. [Lee Felsenstein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Felsenstein)

5. [Square Words](https://xuchef.com/square-words/)

6. [Lessons from Peter Thiel (2010)](https://joelonsdale.com/lessons-peter-thiel/)

7. [Message Maddie: A Raspberry Pi, receipt printer, & the kindness of 700 strangers](https://message-maddie.netlify.app)

8. [Show HN: Created simple video sharing platform](https://www.videotrubka.org/)

9. [Australians to get three hours of free electricity every day under solar scheme](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-03/energy-retailers-offer-free-power-three-hours-dmo/105965472)

10. [Nest Learning Thermostat Gen 1 and 2 Fulu reverse engineering bounty](https://bounties.fulu.org/bounties/nest-learning-thermostat-gen-1-2)

### Summary

1. A woman was mistakenly accused due to a misidentification by a Flock license plate recognition camera but was later cleared of any wrongdoing thanks to evidence from her car's own camera system. This incident highlights the potential for error in surveillance technologies and the importance of supplementary evidence for verification.

2. Recent research suggests a correlation between higher intelligence and left-wing political beliefs, with a component of this relationship appearing to be genetically influenced. This finding contributes to the ongoing debate about the factors that shape our political ideologies and the complex interplay between genetics and environment.

3. Vogue has absorbed Teen Vogue, merging the iconic fashion publication with its younger counterpart in a move that reflects the changing landscape of media and consumption habits. This consolidation may signify a strategic adaptation to the digital age, aiming to streamline operations and leverage brand strength across different demographics.

4. Lee Felsenstein, a pivotal figure in the development of personal computing, played a significant role in the early tech industry. His contributions, particularly in the design of
